item.title: About me
item.description: I am a Sophomore studying computer engineering at University of California, Santa Barbara. During the last summer of highschool, I interned at a company named Trina Solar. This opportunity was my introduction to work culture. My task included data entry and to lead presentations within the company. Currently, I am working part time at UCSB as a Facility Services Operator. I was trained in elementary operations with audio and video equipment, as well as furthered my skill in interpersonal communication and scheduling.

item.title: Ping pong
item.description: The Ping pong Rapid Defence Turret Repeater(PRDTR), is a ping pong ball launcher that was the subject of my ECE 5 course. Me and two other classmates, Vihan Jayaraman, and Jerry Wang, created this as our final project. Abstract Link to heading The main goal of our project was to construct a device that would be able to shoot projectiles with multiple degrees of freedom. We mounted a ping-pong ball launcher on a tiltable mount, giving it 360 degrees of coverage as well as the ability to change the angle of aim.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Ping pong ball launcher Weekly updating slides

item.title: Slides
item.description: This weekly slides updating program was made by me during my internship at Trina. It was mainly used weekly during my internship. Github Link to heading https://github.com/stevenzhujr/Slides Abstract Link to heading The main goal of this project was to write a program that would update slides weekly. I used python and its various libaries to fetch the needed elements from the web, treat them, and then update the slides. Parts Link to heading Webfetch: Using Selenium, I could open browsers remotely.
